decks.notes: The deck focuses on applying early pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Spellstutter Sprite, while maintaining control with Counterspells and removal like Skred and Lightning Bolt. Ninja of the Deep Hours provides card advantage and tempo plays, while Faerie Miscreant and Augur of Bolas help dig for key cards. The mana base is streamlined with snow-covered lands and cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to ensure consistency. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats.

The focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to play aggressively, using low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of creatures with flying and ground creatures, allowing for both aerial and ground assaults. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and mana fixing with cards like Prophetic Prism and Glint Hawk to ensure a steady stream of threats. Ultimately, the goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere.

The main focus of this deck is to deal damage to the opponent as quickly and efficiently as possible using a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By maximizing direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, as well as utilizing creatures like Keldon Marauders and Ghitu Lavarunner, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Fireblast and Incinerate allows for extra reach to finish off the opponent even when they are low on life.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with low-cost, efficient creatures and pump spells, overwhelming the opponent with early aggression. The deck aims to efficiently use mana and leverage cards that provide value, such as Burning-Tree Emissary and Nest Invader, while also protecting key creatures with Silhana Ledgewalker and River Boa. The inclusion of cards like Vines of Vastwood and Rancor help to push through damage and ensure that the deck remains a threatening force throughout the game. Additionally, the deck's reliance on Forests allows for consistent mana development and ensures the deck can function optimally.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on deploying a fast and aggressive board presence, utilizing low-cost creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger. The deck includes cards like Rancor and Vines of Vastwood to increase the efficiency of its creatures, while also having removal options like Hunger of the Howlpack and Gut Shot to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while keeping up pressure with powerful pump spells and combat tricks.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with artifacts in order to power out cheap threats quickly and overwhelm the opponent with aggression. Utilizing a combination of card draw and mana acceleration, it aims to swarm the battlefield with cheap creatures like Myr Enforcer, Frogmite, and Carapace Forger, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Blast to close out the game. The key strategy is to quickly build a board presence and attack aggressively, using the combination of artifacts and efficient threats to outpace and overpower the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out cheap artifacts to power out threats like Myr Enforcer, Frogmite, and Carapace Forger. Using cards like Springleaf Drum and Prophetic Prism to help fix mana and draw cards, along with removal like Galvanic Blast and Fling to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence early in the game and closes out games quickly with powerful creatures and burn spells. It utilizes the Affinity mechanic to cheat out powerful threats at a low cost and puts pressure on the opponent from the start.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and counter spells to tempo out the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, along with disruptive cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. Ponder and Preordain help dig for threats and keep the hand full, while cards like Daze and Gush provide additional versatility and protection. Mutagenic Growth is used to pump up creatures for surprise kills, and Snap can provide additional tempo advantage.

The main focus of this deck revolves around assembling the Urzatron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells and control the game, with cards like Mnemonic Wall and Ghostly Flicker allowing for recursion and value. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with counterspells, removal, and flicker effects, while drawing cards and gaining life to prolong the game until it can establish its mana base and win the game with a highly efficient and overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on early aggression with low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant, supported by countermagic and removal spells. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo advantage. With the ability to draw cards and bounce creatures with Ninja of the Deep Hours, the deck can maintain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Augur of Bolas and Spellstutter Sprite adds versatility and consistency to the deck's strategy.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence with mana-efficient creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary, Nest Invader, and Nettle Sentinel. The deck also includes evasion creatures like Silhana Ledgewalker and River Boa to ensure damage gets through. By utilizing efficient pump spells like Hunger of the Howlpack, Elephant Guide, and Rancor, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy. Quirion Ranger and Vault Skirge provide additional utility and resilience to keep the pressure on opponents.

The deck focuses on delaying and controlling the opponent's plays while ramping up mana using the Urzatron lands. It includes various removal spells and counterspells to deal with threats, as well as card draw and recursion through creatures like Mulldrifter and Mnemonic Wall. The deck's win condition primarily comes from using cards like Rolling Thunder and Dinrova Horror to deal damage to the opponent or bounce their creatures back to their hand. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent by maintaining control and overwhelming them with powerful spells.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on efficiently countering opponent spells while maintaining a tempo advantage through cards like Daze and Snap. The deck utilizes cheap evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Spellstutter Sprite to chip away at the opponent's life total quickly. With card draw spells like Ponder and Preordain, as well as disruptive bounce spells like Vapor Snag, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing the Urzatron lands to generate large amounts of mana, allowing for powerful spells and abilities to be used. By recurring key cards with Mnemonic Wall and Ghostly Flicker, the deck can maintain board advantage and outvalue opponents. Through a combination of removal spells, card draw, and utility lands, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its win conditions. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient resource management and powerful spells.

This deck focuses on using the Urzatron lands to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells and control the game. It utilizes cards like Mulldrifter and Dinrova Horror to draw cards and deal with threats, while also including counterspells like Negate and Prohibit to stop opponents' plays. The deck also includes tools like Pulse of Murasa and Moment's Peace to gain life and buy time. By efficiently ramping up mana and controlling the board, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a game of attrition.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm opponents while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Thraben Inspector and Palace Sentinels. The deck also utilizes artifact lands and mana-fixing artifacts to consistently cast its spells while also providing some protection with cards like Prismatic Strands. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, utilizing a mix of creatures, burn spells, and removal to control the board and pressure opponents to secure a quick victory.
